css_architecture.fact: index.html uses .menu-btn CSS class that conflicts with inline styles
css_architecture.solution: Use !important in CSS class definitions to override inline styles
css_architecture.context: Buttons had inconsistent heights because CSS class and inline styles were fighting for specificity

css_architecture.fact: Manager Logs button is intentionally designed smaller than navigation buttons
css_architecture.solution: NEVER standardize it - keep at 6px padding, font-weight 600, letter-spacing 0.8px
css_architecture.context: User designed it this way on purpose. Changing it was a mistake that had to be reverted.

css_architecture.fact: All pages must use identical base CSS structure
css_architecture.solution: Copy base CSS from foh-checklists.html when creating new pages
css_architecture.context: drivers.html had different font-family and body styling, causing inconsistent appearance. Must use: 'Aptos', 'Segoe UI Variable', -apple-system, etc.

css_architecture.fact: Global button selectors cause conflicts with shared-header.js
css_architecture.solution: Use scoped class names like .driver-button, .amex-button, NOT button {}
css_architecture.context: drivers.html had button {} selector that overrode shared-header.js navigation button styling

navigation_patterns.fact: Standard navigation button dimensions are exact across all pages
navigation_patterns.context: These exact dimensions must be consistent for professional appearance

navigation_patterns.solution: Light buttons: background gray-100, border gray-300, color gray-900. Dark buttons: background gray-700, border gray-700, color white
navigation_patterns.context: Creates visual hierarchy and grouping in navigation grid

user_preferences.fact: User prefers hard refresh instructions after CSS changes
user_preferences.solution: Always remind user to hard refresh (Cmd+Shift+R) to see CSS updates
user_preferences.context: Browser caching can prevent CSS changes from showing immediately

user_preferences.fact: User has intentional design choices that may appear inconsistent
user_preferences.solution: Ask before 'fixing' apparent inconsistencies - they may be deliberate
user_preferences.context: Manager Logs button smaller size was intentional, not a mistake

file_patterns.fact: foh-checklists.html is the CSS reference template
file_patterns.solution: When creating new pages, copy the entire <style> section from foh-checklists.html as base
file_patterns.context: This ensures consistent font-family, CSS variables, body/container styling across all pages

file_patterns.fact: shared-header.js provides consistent navigation for most pages
file_patterns.solution:
Use
+ initializeSharedHeader() for consistent nav
file_patterns.context: FOH, BOH, Catering, Manager, drivers.html all use this. index.html has custom nav.
